House approves fiscal deal

The US House late last night approved a bill reversing income tax increases and pulling the nation back from potentially calamitous economic consequences. (Globe)

Murray plans ambitious legislative agenda

Therese Murray plans to unveil a lengthy agenda today for her final full session as state Senate president, including expansion of early voting, transportation fixes and changes to the welfare system. (Boston Globe)
  • Massachusetts formally opens legislative session today
  • Bill would improve safety for Mass. social workers

Her medical hope grew from within

Marijke Ameigh, 16, is the third person to undergo a procedure pioneered at Boston Children's Hospital in which blood vessels are stretched, providing new material to repair other parts of the body. (Globe)
  • Graphic How doctors repair damaged blood vessels

Fuel oil industry starting to feel the heat

As more Massachusetts households convert to cheaper natural gas, many dealers are expanding services or merging businesses to survive. (Boston Globe)
  • Graphic Changes in home heating | Ways to cut costs

Man, 21, stabbed to death at party

A 21-year-old man was fatally stabbed in Allston early Tuesday as a house party spiraled out of control. It was Boston's first homicide of 2013. (Boston Globe)

The Mass. government plans to eliminate an emergency shelter program that places about 1,700 homeless families in motels and hotels paid by taxpayers.
